info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

get.description: Gets all the express route circuits in a subscription.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRouteCircuit resources.

get.description: Gets all the available express route service providers.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRouteServiceProvider resources.

get.description: Gets all the express route circuits in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resource.

get.description: Gets information about the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of express route circuit.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

put.description: Creates or updates an express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the circuit.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update express route circuit operation.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

delete.description: Deletes the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Delete successful.

202.description: Accepted. Sets 'Disabling' provisioningState until the operation completes. Returns an operation URI that can be queried to find the current state of the operation.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to update express route circuit tags.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

path.description: Autonomous system paths to the destination network.

upDown.description: The length of time that the BGP session has been in the Established state, or the current status if not in the Established state.

v.description: BGP version number spoken to the neighbor.
